TopicTitle: We believe we have found Amelia Earhart's wreckage.

Articles.Content:
Here

Is it her? The world may never know!

Edited October 25, 2015 by musicpenguin

I saw a documentary years ago about what happened. They think it was on a island, cant remember what it was called. They found various artefacts on it such as the remains of a leather sole, as well as some graves that the natives had dug for some people they found dead. There was a picture of the island and in it there was what looked like the remains of a planes landing gear sticking out of the water. They thought that they would of landed on the shallow water and that the tide would of moved the plane but the gear stuck in the soft sand.

This seems to support that as that's would likely be what happened to the plane when it was ripped of the gear and moved by the water.

I heard she shot down by the Japanese and splashed down in the ocean. They took her hostage and eventually executed her. They thought she was an American spy.

There is plenty of evidence and interviews to support this.
rage, thats one of my theories . Also cats.
My theory? She hit a freak storm, ended up crashing. Also, there is no way ANYTHING could have survived a hard crash into the Atlantic Ocean.

I heard that one theory was that when she was flying over a Japanese island, she was forced to land by the military, and when they found a camera aboard her plane, they executed her because they thought she was a spy.
